body.p: The new Government Functional Standard - GovS 007: Security sits at the top of other government security governance documents like the HMG Security Policy Framework (SPF) and the Minimum Cyber Security Standard (MCSS). Together they define the minimum security measures that departments need to implement with regards to protecting their information, technology and digital services to meet their SPF and National Cyber Security Strategy obligations.
Sections 6.9 Cyber security and 6.10 Technical security of the standard state:

ul.li: The security of information and data is essential to good government and public confidence. To operate effectively, HMG needs to maintain the confidentiality, integrity and availability of its information, systems and infrastructure, and the services it provides. Any organisation that handles government information shall meet the standards expected of HM Government.
Technical security relates to the protection of security systems from compromise and/or external interference that may have occurred as a result of an attack.
